articles.title: Talks Held between WPK and CPC Delegations
articles.content:
Talks Held between WPK and CPC Delegations
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The delegations of Workers' Party of Korea and the Communist Party of China had talks at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
					Present at the talks from the WPK side were Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and other officials of the C.C., the WPK including Vice-Department Directors Ri Yong Sik and Kim Song Nam.
					
					Present there from the CPC side were Li Jianguo, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the CPC and vice-chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC, Wang Xiaohui, deputy head of the Publicity Department of the C.C., the CPC, Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC, Yao Zengke, vice-minister of Supervision, other members of the delegation and Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					At the talks the CPC side informed the WPK side of the proceedings of its 18th National Congress.
					
					Both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties and countries and matters of mutual concern.
					
					The talks proceeded in a comradely and friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Reception Given for Chinese Party Delegation
articles.content:
Reception Given for Chinese Party Delegation
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) hosted a reception at Okryu Restaurant on Thursday. It was given in honor of the visiting delegation of the Communist Party of China (CPC) led by Li Jianguo, member of the Political Bureau of its Central Committee and vice-chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress. 
					Present there on invitation were the members of the delegation, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the embassy here. 
					
					Present there were Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., and other officials of the C.C., the WPK including Vice-Department Directors Ri Yong Sik and Kim Song Nam. 
					
					Kim Ki Nam in his speech said the CPC delegation's visit to the DPRK is an expression of the steadfast stand of the new collective leadership of China to value and further develop the traditional DPRK-China friendship forged by the leaders of elder generations of the two countries. 
					
					He said he was pleased with the fact that the 18th National Congress of the CPC was successfully held and Xi Jinping was elected general secretary of the Central Committee and chairman of the Central Military Commission of the CPC. 
					
					It is the invariable will of the WPK and the DPRK government to steadily develop the DPRK-China relations of friendship and cooperation, he said. 
					
					He expressed the belief that the Chinese people would successfully fulfill the tasks set forth in the national congress and make fresh successes in the work for promoting prosperity of China under the leadership of the CPC. 
					
					Li Jianguo said in his speech that it is an expression of the will to boost the relations between the two parties and the two countries that the dear respected Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the WPK, sent a congratulatory message to Xi Jinping upon his election as the general secretary of the Central Committee of the CPC and chairman of the Central Military Commission of the CPC.
					
					He expressed a firm stand to develop the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship together with the DPRK side in the spirit of inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation.
					
					He said he was pleased with the fact that the Korean people closely united around the WPK headed by First Secretary Kim Jong Un have achieved fresh successes in various fields.
					
					He expressed his conviction that the diligent and sagacious Korean people would accomplish the cause of building a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Communist Party of China laid a floral basket before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Thursday and made a bow. The delegation is headed by Li Jianguo, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China.
					A delegation of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan headed by Chairman Kim Hwa Hyo paid tribute to the statues on the same day. The delegation came here to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Academy of Social Sciences.

articles.title: Chinese Party Delegation Here
articles.content:
Chinese Party Delegation Here
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Communist Party of China arrived here on Thursday. It is led by Li Jianguo, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the CPC and vice-chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress.
					The delegation included Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC, Wang Xiaohui, deputy head of the Publicity Department of the C.C., the CPC, Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC, and Yao Zengke, vice-minister of Supervision.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Burkina Faso Ambassador to DPRK
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Burkina Faso Ambassador to DPRK
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Burkina Faso Ambassador to the DPRK Idriss Raoua Ouedraogo at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
					Kim had a talk with the ambassador after receiving the credentials.

articles.title: Cuban Embassy Military Attache Gives Reception
articles.content:
Cuban Embassy Military Attache Gives Reception
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The military attache of the Cuban embassy here on Thursday gave a reception to mark the 56th anniversary of the Day of the Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces.
					Present on invitation were generals and other officers of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned, and diplomatic envoys and military attaches of different countries here. 
					
					Cuban embassy officials were present there.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The delegation of various political parties of the Amur Region Legislative Assembly of Russia led by Olga Lysenko, chief of the United Russia faction who is vice-chairwoman of the assembly, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					The members of the delegation looked round the historic relics preserved with much care at the old home, being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and the family members of Mangyongdae.
					
					They also toured the E-library of Kim Il Sung University, National Gifts Exhibition House, Pyongyang Folklore Park, Breast Cancer Institute of the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, etc.

articles.title: Mongolian Delegation Goes back Home
articles.content:
Mongolian Delegation Goes back Home
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Justice of Mongolia headed by Minister Temuujin Khishigdemberel left here for home on Thursday.

articles.title: DPRK Marks Day of Air Men
articles.content:
DPRK Marks Day of Airmen
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The DPRK marks the Day of Airmen, holiday of its air and anti-air force, on Thursday
					November 29, 1945 President Kim Il Sung, founder of the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK, gave origin to the development of the air and anti-air force of the Korean People's Army by founding the first air force of new Korea immediately after its liberation.
					
					An event was held here to mark the day on Thursday.
					
					Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Hyon Yong Chol, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Kyok Sik, Pak To Chun, and other leading officials, officials of the party, armed forces, power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and service personnel of the KPA and merited innovators.
					
					The meeting began with ceremony of the guard of honor of the KPA air and anti-air force.
					
					The DPRK flag and the flag of the Supreme Commander were raised.
					
					The march-past of the guard of honor was followed by the well organized formation change and spirited and peculiar rhythm and revolutionary songs of the KPA military band and the female brass band of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces which showed revolutionary spirit and aspect of the KPA air force.
					
					Then the demonstration performance started by players of the Pyongyang Air Club and art flying by the flying corps of the air and anti-air force.
					
					Radio-controlled model gliders showed colorful artful movements.
					
					They skillfully performed speed flying, 360 degrees revolution and endurance flight. The sky was spectacular by the beautiful smoke screens after the gliders.
					
					Collective apex falling and collective acrobatic falling were performed by male and female parachuters.
					
					The flights decorated the sky with vapor trail with such art flying as horizontal, rising, falling and turning.
					
					The event came to a brilliant conclusion with the military music by the military band of the KPA and the brass band of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces.

articles.title: Invincible Might of KPA Air Force
articles.content:
Invincible Might of KPA Air Force
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The people of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea celebrate the Day of Air Men on Thursday. On November 29 of 1945, President Kim Il Sung organized the flying corps of new Korea after its liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.
					Visiting the Sinuiju branch of the Korean Aviation Association at that time, the President made a historic speech titled "Let Us Create the Air Force of the New Korea" to indicate the tasks and ways for building the Juche-based air force.
					
					Since then, the air force of the DPRK has displayed its invincible might under the guidance of the brilliant commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					In the period of the Fatherland Liberation War (June 1950-July 1953), the young Air and Anti-Air Force of the Korean People's Army created a lot of myths, unprecedented in the world history of air force, in the showdown with the U.S. air force boasting of "air supremacy". The KPA pilots demolished the south Korean air force only in three days after the start of the war, while defeating the U.S. air pirates. They shot down more than 2 500 war planes of the enemy during the war.
					
					The KPA air force frustrated U.S. aerial provocations on many occasions after the war. In the 1960s, it shot down the U.S. "EC-121", that intruded into the DPRK's airspace, killing 30 odd airmen aboard it. In 2010, a KPA airplane drove out the U.S. "RC-135" of the DPRK airspace.
					
					A number of DPRK heroes were registered in the KPA Air and Anti-Air Force.
					
					In his inspection tour of the KPA Air and Anti-Air Force Command in May this year, Marshal Kim Jong Un highly praised the unit for its enormous contributions to developing the nation's air force. And he stressed that the KPA air force could be developed into an invincible one thanks to the distinguished military idea and wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Model Plane Operators of DPRK's Textile Mill Sports Team
articles.content:
Model Plane Operators of DPRK's Textile Mill Sports Team
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Kaesong Textile Mill Sports Team in the DPRK boasts of successful model plane operators.
					The operators have bagged 13 cups and more than 100 gold medals in international and national contests over the last 10 odd years.
					
					It was five years ago that they made preparations to take part in international aero model contests. They applied new technologies to manufacturing model planes, putting spurs to intensifying training.
					
					They attended the 2008 International Free Flying Aero Model Contest for Mongolian Cup, the first international tournament for them, and placed first in rubber-propelled aero model and glider team events.
					
					They also took gold medals in the glider team and individual events of the 2011 International Free Flying Aero Model Contest for Mongolian Cup.
					
					This year, they won trophies and gold medals in the World Cup Free Flying Aero Model Contest and the Asian Free Flying Aero Model Championships.

articles.title: Open-air Ice Rink in Pyongyang Crowded with Visitors
articles.content:
Open-air Ice Rink in Pyongyang Crowded with Visitors
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The People's Open-air Ice Rink, recently built on the bank of the Taedong River in Pyongyang, is daily crowded with visitors who want to practice skating technique.
					Han Hyon Il, a student of Kim Chaek University of Technology, told KCNA that he was very pleased to enjoy skating in this fantastic ice rink.
					
					Many people, including boys, girls and even aged persons, come here to do speed and figure skating. Assistants and parents teach kids or their children how to glide on the ice. An assistant said that children aged 4-5 make a rapid progress in learning how to skate, some of them drawing attention of experts.
					
					According to Pak Jong Man, chief engineer of the Ice Rink, more than 10 000 people visited it in the last 10 odd days.

articles.title: Choe Son Hui, Noted Rhythmic Gymnast in DPRK
articles.content:
Choe Son Hui, Noted Rhythmic Gymnast in DPRK
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Choe Son Hui is a teacher at a primary school attached to the Sinuiju Teacher Training College in North Phyongan Province of Korea
					According to the principal of the primary school, Ri Myong Hwa, Choe volunteered to work at the school after graduating from a college of physical education in September 1984.
					
					Over the last 20 odd years, the school took the titles for 13 times in national rhythmic gymnastics tournaments of primary schools. It garnered 220 gold and 200 silver medals while turning out many rhythmic gymnasts. The school gained the title of the twice model physical training school.
					
					For her devoted services, Choe was awarded the title of the October 8 Model Teacher.

articles.title: Jindallae Children's Foundation Created
articles.content:
Jindallae Children's Foundation Created
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- There took place at the People's Palace of Culture here on Nov. 29 a ceremony of establishing Jindallae Children's Foundation and donating funds.
					Present there were Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries of the DPRK, and officials concerned and the visiting delegation for the establishment of the foundation headed by Jindallae Saphariny and foreign diplomats and embassy officials here.
					
					First, there was a ceremony of declaring the creation of the foundation.
					
					An agreement on setting up the foundation was inked at the ceremony.
					
					Congratulatory speeches were made by Kim Jong Suk, Jindallae Saphariny and Ma Zhenxuan, chairman of the Public Diplomacy and Culture Exchange Co., Ltd. in Beijing.
					
					The speakers said that the foundation was established thanks to the noble outlook on the rising generations of leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un and sincere efforts exerted by foreign figures.
					
					Warmly congratulating the creation of the foundation as part of friendship, cooperation and humanitarianism, they said the foundation would contribute to providing people and children of the DPRK with happy life.
					
					Then the certificate of the donation was conveyed.
					
					A letter of the delegation to Kim Jong Un was read out there.

articles.title: Construction of Dam of Wonsan Army-People Power Station Finished
articles.content:
Construction of Dam of Wonsan Army-People Power Station Finished
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The building of a dam was completed at the Wonsan Army-People Power Station.
					The successful building of the dam created a huge reservoir in a deep mountain by turning the flow of a river to the East Sea from its original direction to the West Sea. It will provide a guarantee for the development of the economy of Kangwon Province including Wonsan City and improvement of the standard of people's living.

articles.title: Lair of King Tongmyong's Unicorn Reconfirmed in DPRK
articles.content:
Lair of King Tongmyong's Unicorn Reconfirmed in DPRK
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Archaeologists of the History Institute of the DPRK Academy of Social Sciences have recently reconfirmed a lair of the unicorn rode by King Tongmyong, founder of the Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668).
					The lair is located 200 meters from the Yongmyong Temple in Moran Hill in Pyongyang City. A rectangular rock carved with words "Unicorn Lair" stands in front of the lair. The carved words are believed to date back to the period of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392).
					
					Jo Hui Sung, director of the Institute, told KCNA:
					
					"Korea's history books deal with the unicorn, considered to be ridden by King Tongmyong, and its lair.
					
					The Sogyong (Pyongyang) chapter of the old book 'Koryo History' (geographical book), said: Ulmil Pavilion is on the top of Mt. Kumsu, with Yongmyong Temple, one of Pyongyang's eight scenic spots, beneath it. The temple served as a relief palace for King Tongmyong, in which there is the lair of his unicorn.
					
					The old book 'Sinjungdonggukyojisungnam' (Revised Handbook of Korean Geography) complied in the 16th century wrote that there is a lair west of Pubyok Pavilion in Mt. Kumsu.
					
					The discovery of the unicorn lair, associated with legend about King Tongmyong, proves that Pyongyang was a capital city of Ancient Korea as well as Koguryo Kingdom."

articles.title: Presentation of IT Achievements Held
articles.content:
Presentation of IT Achievements Held
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A national public presentation of IT achievements took place at the Grand People's Study House and Kim Chaek University of Technology here from Nov. 27 to 29. 
					Present there were officials, scientists, technicians, teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Institute of Mathematics of the State Academy of Sciences, Central Information Communications Centre and other units. 
					
					It was divided into panels of educational information, scientific and technological information, computer technology and information communications. 
					
					More than 540 papers were made public at the presentation. 
					
					There was introduction of successes and experience gained in the work for rapidly developing information technology including information service, information maths, computer network system, information communications and security technology.
					
					Drawing attention of the participants were papers on reasonable composition of education information system and technology for realizing it, information service supporting system, fuzzy maths for modeling of information system, computer hardware and embedding hardware design, space communications and satellite communications. 
					
					Software of designing different kinds of games, achievements in cognizing multimedia and technology of using it and others were highly appreciated as materials conducive to improving software development and application ability. 
					
					During the days lectures on the trend of developing information science and technology were given.

articles.title: DPRK Makes Efforts to Preserve Cultural Relics
articles.content:
DPRK Makes Efforts to Preserve Cultural Relics
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is exerting efforts to preserve cultural relics.
					Officials and workers in the relevant field this year achieved success in the work of maintaining the original appearance of the cultural heritages on the principle of historicism.
					
					They also successfully restored the flood-damaged ones to the original state.
					
					People in the capital Pyongyang repainted or repaired the historical buildings such as those on Moran Hill and Mounts Taesong and Ryongak and spruced up their surrounding areas.
					
					The management of Taedong Gate, Ryongwang Pavilion, Pothong Gate, King Tongmyong's Mausoleum, etc., has been improved.
					
					Officials and employees of the Myohyangsan History Museum thoroughly repaired the Kwanum Hall, and maintained the Kumgang and Sangwon temples. They also restored the flood-hit road in time.
					
					Working people of Kaesong City repaired the heavy rain- and storm-damaged Kaesong walls, Manwoldae and Mausoleum of King Kongmin, and colorfully repainted the Nam Gate and Sungyang School.
					
					Efforts are directed to preserving the Mausoleum of King Wang Kon, founder of Koryo, and the relics in the areas around Pakyon Falls.
					
					The place around the monument to the victory in the battle in the northern area of Korea, the Kaesim Temple on Mt. Chilbo and the Kyongsong South Gate and other relics have been restored to their former glory in a short span of time by people of North Hamgyong Province.
					
					People in South Hamgyong Province are taking good care of the Kuchon Pavilion, the Ryangchon Temple in Kowon County, Anbul Temple in Kumya County and Jonggwang Temple in Riwon County.
					
					Officials and people of Uiju and Pakchon counties in North Phyongan Province repaired the Chongun Shrine of Kumgwang Temple and the Chongphung Tower of Simwon Temple.
					
					People in North Hwanghae Province repaired Kommunmoru Site and the Myongbu Hall of Songbul Temple on Mt. Jongbang to their original state.
					
					People in the provinces of Kangwon, Jagang and South Hwanghae are also making devoted efforts for the preservation of relics.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Protect Biodiversity
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Protect Biodiversity
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Nature Conservation Union of Korea is greeting its 53rd anniversary on Thursday.
					In this regard, KCNA met Jang Il Nam, a section chief of the Union Central Committee.
					
					Jang said:
					
					The Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government consider the protection of natural environment as one of the patriotic works for the nation's prosperity.
					
					In the country there are many nature conservations and sanctuaries, including areas of Mts. Paektu, Myohyang and Oga. And rare and extinctive animals and plants are designated as natural monuments.
					
					The days from November to next March each year are set as a period for protection of forests and underground resources and the days from March to July as a period for protection of useful animals.
					
					The government has built many nurseries and farms for saplings, fries and such animals as pheasant and roe deer throughout the country.
					
					We'll work harder to improve the nation's natural environment and conserve natural resources while stepping up international exchanges and cooperation for protection of biodiversity.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Censures S. Korea's Moves to Block Tour of Mt. Kumgang
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Censures S. Korea's Moves to Block Tour of Mt. Kumgang
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea has gone sordid in its moves to shift the responsibility for the suspended tour of Mt. Kumgang on to the DPRK.
					A spokesman for the "Ministry of Unification" on Nov. 19 talked about "guarantee of personal safety of tourists", saying that he "hoped for the north's sincere measures".
					
					On Nov. 26, the spokesman again talked nonsense that the guarantee of the personal safety of south Korean tourists at the highest level was not included in the "agreement between authorities".
					
					This is sheer sophism aimed to cover up its criminal act of having scotched the tour of Mt. Kumgang, symbol of the north-south reconciliation and cooperation.
					
					The Lee group is the chief culprit which suspended the tour that had been favorably under way for nearly a decade amid the expectation and concern of the public at home and abroad.
					
					Soon after coming to power, the Lee group together with the "Saenuri Party" ragtag desperately stood against the tour, talking about "financial resources".
					
					With the tourist incident in July 2008, the group unilaterally suspended the tour.
					
					As far as the responsibility for the tourist incident is concerned, it was caused by the tourist's carelessness, and the responsibility rests with the south Korean authorities who took loose control of the tourists. 
					
					However, the group of traitors continued to raise the issue of "personal safety". This is aimed to evade the responsibility for the suspension and quench the increasing demand of south Koreans for the resumption of the tour.
					
					Explicitly speaking, there is no such issue as the "safety of tourists" in the DPRK as touted by the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					The auxiliary agreement on tour of Mt. Kumgang which was concluded between the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee and the Hyundai Group in October 1998 and the agreement on entrance and exit out of Kaesong Industrial Zone and tourist zone of Mt. Kumgang that was adopted at the 13th north-south ministerial talks in February 2004 specified all articles regarding the guarantee of the safety of the south side's personnel and the provision of convenience for their entrance and exit.
					
					In May 2000, the DPRK side showed special sincerity of issuing a memorandum on the guarantee of safety of the south Korean tourists and handed it over to the south side.
					
					During Pyongyang visit by the chairwoman of the Hyundai Group in August 2009, the DPRK side gave assurances at the highest level as for the issue of safety of the south Korean tourists and officially made public it through the joint press release between the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee and the Hyundai Group.
					
					The DPRK repeatedly proposed talks for the resumption of the tour by sending notices to the south side on several times.
					
					But the south Korean authorities keen on escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen, only kept raising "three conditions" and evaded the resumption of the tour. Finally they stooped to such an arrogant act of disrupting the negotiations.
					
					All facts prove that the scotched tour and failed resumption are attributable to the puppet conservative regime's vicious hostile policy toward the DPRK, not to the issue of "personal safety".
					
					The south Korean authorities' denial of the resumption of tour is precisely that of the north-south ties, north-south joint declarations and reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					
					The south Koreans and all other Koreans crave the earlier resumption of the tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					The Lee group and the "Saenuri Party" can never stem the desire and demand of the south Koreans to reopen the tour of Mt. Kumgang.

articles.title: KPA Is Creator of People's Happiness: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
KPA Is Creator of People's Happiness: Rodong Sinmun
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Korean People's Army (KPA) is the defender of the country and creator of the people's happiness, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined article. 
					The article goes on:
					
					Today the service personnel of the KPA do good things for the people at a high level at a breath, encouraged by the noble outlook of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un on the people. 
					
					The service personnel thoroughly carry out the orders without bargaining or calculation. 
					
					Their only answer is "yes" although they face huge project fraught with big ordeals.
					
					In such strong spirit and guts they launched the project of improving Hapjang and Pothong rivers in single mind by removing sludge holding aloft the flag of the supreme commander before setting up their camping sites. 
					
					The miracles and innovations being made in the main fronts for building a thriving nation are unthinkable without the heroic struggle of the service personnel.
					
					Their feats are in direct proportion to the offensive speed and the people's happiness is being created by them. 
					
					The service personnel unsparingly devote their patriotic sweats to carrying out the order of the supreme commander. Then they leave for another front to carry out new orders.

articles.title: S. Koreans Called upon to Punish Lee Myung Bak Regime
articles.content:
S. Koreans Called upon to Punish Lee Myung Bak Regime
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean people will surely win in their struggle for wiping out the anti-reunification forces, improving the north-south relations and opening up a broad avenue of an independent reunification, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a bylined article.
					It is quite natural for south Koreans of different social standings to turn out in protest against the Lee Myung Bak regime's anti-DPRK moves in order to punish it in the "presidential election" and mend the north-south ties, says the article, adding:
					
					After the publication of the historic June 15 joint declaration, the north and the south promoted dialogue, cooperation and exchange to alleviate misunderstanding and mistrust and make epochal achievements in the movement for national reunification, unprecedented in the nation's history of the division.
					
					All these, however, came to naught after Lee Myung Bak took office as he singled out the confrontation with fellow countrymen as its policy.
					
					Because the north-south relations affect the nation's destiny, the DPRK has given rational recommendations to the south Korean ruling forces and made sincere efforts to open up a way of dialogue and cooperation with utmost patience.
					
					However, the Lee Myung Bak regime took a negative approach toward the DPRK's will for normalizing north-south relations and resorted to more frantic anti-DPRK confrontation moves in collusion with foreign forces.
					
					The past five years brought home to south Koreans the fact that what the Lee Myung Bak group wanted was the confrontation, not the improved north-south relations, and that it would bring only a war disaster.
					
					South Koreans are determined to change the regime without fail because they are convinced that if the conservative "Saenuri Party" comes to power, it will be impossible to improve the north-south relations.

articles.title: Committees for Remembering Kim Jong Il Inaugurated Abroad
articles.content:
Committees for Remembering Kim Jong Il Inaugurated Abroad
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Committees for remembering leader Kim Jong Il were formed with due ceremonies in Mexico, Tajikistan and Uganda on November 22 and 23.
					At the inaugural ceremonies Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, and the chairman of the Kampala City Committee of the Uganda National Resistance Movement were elected chairmen of the remembrance committees.
					
					The remembrance committees decided to hold colorful political and cultural events including remembrance meeting, lecture and seminar on the occasion of the 1st anniversary of the demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Russian Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Russian Newspaper
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Russian newspaper Patriot No. 43-44 carried the full text of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Children of Revolutionary Martyrs Should Become Dependable Backbone of Songun Revolution That Gives Steady Continuity to Bloodline of Mangyongdae, Bloodline of Mt. Paektu".
					The work, published on October 12, 2012, says the schools are Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il revolutionary schools which were founded and developed under the care of the great persons of Mt. Paektu and centers for training the backbone of the Songun revolution.
					
					It also indicates the responsibilities and duties of the revolutionary schools.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Bangladeshi Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Bangladeshi Newspapers
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi newspapers carried special write-ups on November 20 on the occasion of the first anniversary of the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Daily Fork carried in eight pages articles titled "Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism" and "Faith of the DPRK" with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					The paper said that the world lost the most outstanding great man with the unexpected passing of Kim Jong Il. It referred to his ideological and theoretical exploits and immortal contribution to the cause of socialism and independence against imperialism.
					
					It noted that Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is an integrated system of ideology, theory and method of Juche and clarifies the revolutionary theories, strategies and tactics of the era of independence, adding that the Korean people are full of will to advance along the way of independence, Songun and socialism to the end.
					
					Natun Katha carried an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il will live forever" which said:
					
					Kim Jong Il, master of ideology and theory, comprehensively developed the Juche idea and the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					He published many works encompassing all fabrics of social life such as politics, military affairs, economy and culture to steadily develop and enrich the Juche idea.
					
					He also dynamically promoted the cause of global independence upholding the banner of independence against imperialism and positively supported the countries and people aspiring after socialism and independence in their struggle.
					
					History never knows such a great man who devoted all his life to the people as Kim Jong Il.
					
					He will always live in the hearts of the Korean people and progressive mankind.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary Marked by Bangladeshi Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary Marked by Bangladeshi Organization
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy issued a bulletin titled "Conviction of Korea" on November 21 on the occasion of the first anniversary of the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The bulletin said:
					
					Kim Jong Il firmly defended socialism, life of the Korean people, from the imperialists' moves to stifle it by pursuing his original Songun politics.
					
					The Korean people are full of pledge to brilliantly carry forward the cause of Kim Jong Il generation after generation under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					Kim Jong Un, who is identical to Kim Jong Il in idea, leadership and personality, is possessed of all-round rich knowledge in various fields including politics, military affairs, economy and culture.
					
					In particular, he is well versed in the military affairs and latest science and technology, having matchless courage and pluck, extraordinary organizing ability and eminent far-seeing wisdom.
					
					No force in the world can block the advance of the Korean people who are united close behind Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Russia Expands Sphere of Influence: News Analyst
articles.content:
Russia Expands Sphere of Influence: News Analyst
						
Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Russia has recently drawn world attention as it moves to expand its influence to the Mideast and other regions, challenging the U.S. and other Western nations' supremacy.
					As already known, the U.S. and other Western countries are in the mire as a result of their wars in Iraq and Afghanistan that caused increasing human and material losses.
					
					The slogans of "freedom", "democracy" and "prosperity" advocated by them to justify the wars were proven to be hypocritical. This has increased disillusion among inhabitants and made even the authorities supported by the West turn their backs.
					
					It has become the general tide to exclude the U.S. and other Western nations.
					
					Availing itself of this opportunity, Russia launched a full-scale diplomatic campaign to marginalize the U.S. and the Western nations.
					
					When Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri Al-Maliki visited Russia in October,
					
					President Vladimir Putin and Prime Minister Dmitri Medvedev met him respectively to discuss many issues including cooperation in energy and military technology.
					
					Especially the military cooperation topped their discussion which resulted in concluding a series of military contracts.
					
					During his visit, Maliki underlined the need of Russia's support to his country's military and security fields, declaring that Iraq is of the stand to establish closer partnership with Russia.
					
					A Russian expert on Mideast issues said the resumption of cooperation between Russia and Iraq in the sensitive military field that had been stagnant for nearly a decade was a very important fact.
					
					The public opined that with Iraq's increasing tendency to keep itself aloof from the U.S. in the backdrop, Russia and Iraq met their common purpose of reestablishing bilateral relations through Maliki's visit.
					
					As for Afghanistan, Russia has taken approach of restoring its influence as in the past.
					
					The Russian paper Pravda on Nov. 20 carried an article titled "Russia is getting more sincere in Afghanistan" which said the government reviewed in full scale its policy toward the country.
					
					Russia has also taken more offensive attitude towards the U.S. and other Western nations' attempt to take hold of Central Asian countries.
					
					Russia recently decided to offer military and technological aid to Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan.
					
					Experts say Russia's measure is intended to dispossess the NATO of its supremacy in Asia.
					
					Observers foresee a fiercer standoff between Russia and the U.S. and other Western countries over the world's major strategic regions and strife to seize control of them.

articles.title: MINREX denuncia aprobacion de "resolucion de DDHH" anti-RPDC
articles.content:
MINREX denuncia aprobacion de "resolucion de DDHH" anti-RPDC
						
Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- En relacion con que fue aprobada en la reunion del tercer comite del 67o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU la "resolucion de DDHH" anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC respondio el dia 28 a la pregunta de un reportero de la ACNC como sigue:
					Tal documento inventado por el papel principal de la Union Europea y Japon no vale nada siendo producto intrigante de propaganda politica de las fuerzas hostiles redactado por datos falsificados.
					
					Las fuerzas occidentales, que siguen a ciegas a la politica de hostilidad anti-RPDC de EE.UU. con la acostumbrada repugnancia al regimen socialista, se entregan cada ano a las ridiculas acciones de fraude politico para denigrar la imagen internacional de la RPDC que se aumenta cada dia mas.
					
					La conducta de EE.UU. y sus fuerzas satelites para difamar a los paises independientes y mantener el antiguo orden internacional de dominio y subyugacion actuando como "juez de DDHH" no reconocido por nadie, suscita solo la censura y burla de la humanidad progresista.
					
					La RPDC rechaza totalmente y denuncia severamente la aprobacion de la "resolucion de DDHH" anti-RPDC de las fuerzas hostiles encaminada a denigrar el regimen socialista al estilo coreano centrado en las masas populares abusando del noble ideal de DDHH con el malsano proposito politico.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre las delegaciones del PTC y PCCh
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre las delegaciones del PTC y PCCh
						
Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 29 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre las delegaciones del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Partido Comunista de China.
					Asistieron a la ocasion el miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, los subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC Ri Yong Sik y Kim Song Nam y otros funcionarios, por la parte coreana, y por la contraparte, el miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PCCh y vicepresidente del Comite Permanente de la Asamblea Popular Nacional de la Republica Popular China, Li Jianguo, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh, Wang Jiarui, el subjefe del Departamento de Propaganda del CC del PCCh, Wang Xiaohui, el subjefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh, Liu Jieyi, el viceministro de Superintendencia, Yao Zengke y otros miembros de la delegacion asi como el embajador chino en Corea Liu Hongcai.
					
					Tras informar el estado de la realizacion del 18o Congreso del PCCh, ambas partes intercambiaron criterios sobre el mayor desarrollo de las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre dos partidos y dos paises y otros problemas de interes mutuo.
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente camaraderil y amistoso.

Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador Burkina Faso

articles.title: ACNC condena sofismas de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
ACNC condena sofismas de autoridades surcoreanas
						
Pyongyang, 29 de noviembre (ACNC) -- La banda del traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak trata de imputar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea la responsabilidad del cese del turismo al monte Kumgang.
					El dia 19, el portavoz del Ministerio titere de Unificacion dijo de la supuesta "garantia de seguridad personal de los turistas" y agrego que "desea medidas sinceras del Norte (de Corea)".
					
					El dia 26 preciso que no es un "acuerdo entre las autoridades" sobre el hecho de que la RPDC habia asegurado en maximo nivel la seguridad personal de los turistas surcoreanos.
					
					Esto resulta un sofisma cinico de los que intentan encubrir sus delitos criminales de haber frustrado el turismo al monte Kumgang, simbolo de reconciliacion y cooperacion Norte-Sur.
					
					La camarilla de Lee es el autor que detuvo el turismo al monte Kumgang que se realizaba bien durante casi 10 anos atrayendo la atencion del interior y exterior del pais.
					
					Tan pronto como tomara el poder, en contubernio con los compinches del "Partido Saenuri", impidio de manera siniestra el turismo al monte Kumgang hablando de la llamada "fuente de dinero" de alguien.
					
					En julio de 2008 ceso unilateralmente el turismo pretextando el incidente de una turista surcoreana, cuya responsabilidad recaia de punto a cabo a la turista y a las autoridades surcoreanas que no cuidaron y controlaron bien a sus turistas.
					
					Sin embargo, la banda traidora sigue cuestionando el tema de "seguridad personal" con el objetivo de evitar la responsabilidad del cese del turismo al monte Kumgang y calmar la cada dia mas creciente demanda de reanudar el turismo.
					
					A decir verdad, no hay en la RPDC el problema de "seguridad personal de turista"  de que hablan ruidosamente los titeres surcoreanos.
					
					El "acuerdo auxiliar sobre el turismo al monte Kumgang" firmado en octubre de 1998 entre el Comite Coreano por la Paz de Asia y el Pacifico (CCPAP) y el Grupo Hyundai y el "acuerdo sobre la entrada y la permanencia en la Zona Industrial de Kaesong y la zona de turismo al monte Kumgang" aprobado en febrero de 2004 en las XIII conversiones N-S a nivel ministerial, estipulan en detalles todos los articulos que se presentan en el aseguramiento de las comodidades necesarias a la seguridad personal y la salida y entrada de los miembros de la parte surena.
					
					En mayo de 2000, la parte nortena entrego a la surena la nota relativa a la seguridad personal de los turistas surcoreanos en nombre del ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo.
					
					En agosto de 2009 cuando la presidenta del Grupo Hyundai visitaba Pyongyang, le dio garantia en un nivel supremo a la seguridad personal de los turistas surcoreanos y lo publico oficialmente al interior y exterior a traves de la informacion conjunta entre CCPAP y el Hyundai.
					
					Para reanudar el turismo, la parte nortena propuso reiteradamente a su contraparte efectuar las conversaciones enviando en varias ocasiones los documentos de aviso.
					
					Pero, las autoridades surcoreanas enloquecidas en la confrontacion fratricida evadieron la reanudacion del turismo so pretexto de las "tres premisas" y a la larga, actuo con arrogancia abandonando el lugar de conversaciones.
					
					Todos los hechos demuestran claramente que la suspension y la no reanudacion del turismo al monte Kumgang se deben no al "problema de seguridad personal" de alguien sino a la politica conflictiva anti-RPDC de la banda conservadora del Sur de Corea.
					
					La negacion de las autoridades surcoreanas a la reanudacion del turismo es la negacion a las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas, a la declaracion conjunta N-S y a la reconciliacion, la unidad y la reunificacion.
					
					Ahora, los habitantes surcoreanos y otros coreanos desean la reanudacion pronta del turismo al monte Kumgang.
					
					La banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak y del "Partido Saenuri" nunca podra detener la aspiracion de los habitantes surcoreanos a reanudar el turismo al monte Kumgang.
